result.execSummary:
The defendant David C Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$528  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Agent to regulate. Must get agent's approval for any work/school/volunteer opportunites.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Shall not live anywhere alcohol or unprescribed controlled substances are present. May not posses or use Ritalin.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any financial institution or bank except Associated Bank on Whitney Way in Madison, WI. May not possess anything that could conceal your identity.
2/10/16 Crt amends JOC to change address of Associated Bank location from Whitney Way to 3020 Fish Hatchery Rd, Fitchburg, WI 53713.

Take prescription medicine as prescribed. Meet with psychiatrist or counselor at least monthly. Provide supervising agent with letter of apology written to victims who will forward to designated recipient. Meet with probation agent at a minimum of every other week. Agent must be a mental health agent.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon, including firearms and knives.

timeConds.notes: With huber. For any treatment, counseling or employment to include volunteer work. Credit DOES apply.
100 hours per year with written verification to agent.

ADDRESS INFO for David C Anderson
Current: 2702 McDivitt Rd Apt 3, Madison, WI 53713 United States  (Effective: 09-02-2015)
Prior: 7355 Tree Ln, Madison, WI 53717-1552 United States
modifying bond

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $15,000.00 effective 08-19-2015 at 8:00 a.m. per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 9:00 A.M. on August 19, 2015.  
-  Defendant shall comply with all rules of BMP.
-  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $15,000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kristin C.  or his daughter I.C. without permission of BMP.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any bank or financial institution other than Associated Bank on Whitney Way.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess anything which conceals his identity, to include ski masks, masks, fake beards, etc.
- Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.  
- Defendant shall meet at least monthly with staff of Journey Mental Health.
Trial Judge - Br 11
to modify bond, no objection from ADA

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $15,000.00 effective 08-19-2015 at 8:00 a.m. per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 9:00 A.M. on August 19, 2015.  
-  Defendant shall comply with all rules of BMP.

- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- Defendant shall not use or possess anything which conceals his identity, to include ski masks, masks, fake beards, etc.
